forecast-period.text: Wind gusts can be 40 percent stronger than the averages given here, and maximum waves may be up to twice the height.
Details of warnings are available on the Bureau's website www.bom.gov.au, by telephone 1300-659-218* or through some TV and radio broadcasts.
* Calls to 1300 number cost around 27.5c inc. GST, higher from mobiles or public phones. Marine forecasts are also available on VHF and HF radio. View the radio schedule on www.bom.gov.au/marine
Check the latest Coastal Waters Forecast or Local Waters Forecast for information on wind, wave and weather conditions for these coastal zones.

A high pressure system in the Bight is extending a ridge into New South Wale in the wake of a cold front. This high is expected to maintain a ridge over coastal parts for the next few days as it drifts slowly east, likely reaching the Tasman Sea early in the new week. As a result, coastal winds should remain generally southerly through this period.
Winds: Southwesterly 10 to 15 knots turning south to southeasterly in the afternoon, locally reaching 20 knots. Seas: Below 0.5 metres. Weather: Sunny morning. 20% chance of a shower this evening.
Winds: South to southeasterly 10 to 15 knots. Seas: Below 0.5 metres. Weather: Partly cloudy. 70% chance of showers.
Winds: Southerly 10 to 15 knots decreasing to about 10 knots during the evening. Seas: Below 1 metre. Weather: Cloudy. 60% chance of showers.
Winds: South to southwesterly 10 to 15 knots tending south to southeasterly below 10 knots during the day. Seas: Below 1 metre. Weather: Partly cloudy. 60% chance of showers.
